summary: Build an app for managing and sharing wedding photos.
known_issues: Deployment/redeploy attempt failed with a deployment error; user requests another deploy to get a fresh live link.

existing_features.title: Create a coherent wedding-themed visual design system for the app (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) and apply it consistently across all screens using Tailwind + existing UI components (no blue/purple-dominant palette unless needed for contrast).

Implement Internet Identity sign-in and show authenticated state in the UI (signed in principal / sign out), gating photo management features (upload, album creation, share settings) behind authentication.

Build photo upload UX: allow authenticated users to select one or multiple images, show progress/status per file, and add the uploaded photos to a selected album (or a default album if none selected).

Build album and gallery UI: album list screen, album detail screen with responsive photo grid, photo viewer modal/page (next/previous), and basic photo metadata display (caption, upload date, optional download button).
Implement sharing: allow authenticated users to create and revoke public share links for an album (read-only). Public viewers can open a share URL to browse that album without signing in.
Add basic organization features: allow authenticated users to set/edit album name, set photo captions, and reorder photos within an album (simple up/down or drag-and-drop).

Add core UX states and safety: loading skeletons/spinners for album/photo queries, empty states (no albums, no photos), error toasts/messages for failed uploads/queries, and confirm dialogs for destructive actions (delete photo/album, revoke share).
Generate required static brand assets and render them in the UI (store under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference them directly from the frontend).
Add an in-app way for users to obtain and copy the current live app URL (the deployment link) so the link can be shared without relying on past chat messages.

Add a small “Help / Troubleshooting” section accessible from the main UI that explains, in English, what to do if the app fails to load after a deploy/redeploy and how to retrieve/copy the current app link.
Add a repository documentation file with deterministic steps for local/prod deployment and for finding the deployed frontend URL and canister IDs.

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an app for wedding photos (upload, organize, and share wedding photo collection).

Add backend data models and APIs to store wedding photo metadata and image blobs in the single Motoko actor, including: albums, photos (filename, contentType, byteSize, createdAt, optional caption), and album membership/order.

projectName: Wedding photo app: upload, organize, and share
